docs.abstract: The clash has consequences beyond New York, going to the heart of a national debate likely to dominate the 2020 election: What is the best way to spread prosperity?
docs.snippet: The clash has consequences beyond New York, going to the heart of a national debate likely to dominate the 2020 election: What is the best way to spread prosperity?
docs.lead_paragraph: The political opposition that prompted Amazon to walk away from building a corporate headquarters in New York City featured a touchstone of the progressives’ economic agenda: ending tax policies that unfairly reward and pamper the wealthy.

headline.main: In Amazon Fight, Progressives Showed What They Want: A New Economic Agenda
headline.print_headline: Amazon’s Exit Reignites a Debate Over Growth

docs.abstract: We dare you to live through 2018 — again.
docs.snippet: We dare you to live through 2018 — again.
docs.lead_paragraph: We dare you to live through 2018 — again.

headline.main: What Happened in 2018? Shake to Remember

byline.original: By Tracy Ma, Blacki Migliozzi and Bonnie Wertheim

docs.abstract: At its heart, privacy is about how data is used to take away our control.
docs.snippet: At its heart, privacy is about how data is used to take away our control.
docs.lead_paragraph: This article is part of a limited-run newsletter. You can sign up here.

headline.main: Privacy Is Too Big to Understand

docs.abstract: Companies have said for decades that we should be in charge of our data. Why now, more than ever, does it seem like we aren’t?
docs.snippet: Companies have said for decades that we should be in charge of our data. Why now, more than ever, does it seem like we aren’t?
docs.lead_paragraph: Companies have said for decades that we should be in charge of our data. Why now, more than ever, does it seem like we aren’t?

byline.original: By Charlie Warzel and Stuart A. Thompson

docs.abstract: In 2018, there were some early glimmers that corporate America is realizing bigger isn’t always better.
docs.snippet: In 2018, there were some early glimmers that corporate America is realizing bigger isn’t always better.
docs.lead_paragraph: Get the DealBook newsletter to make sense of major business and policy headlines — and the power-brokers who shape them.__________

headline.main: In 2018, Did Business Get Too Big?

docs.abstract: “Homecoming,” “Dirty John” and “Lore” are just the first in a likely wave of headphone-to-screen adaptations.
docs.snippet: “Homecoming,” “Dirty John” and “Lore” are just the first in a likely wave of headphone-to-screen adaptations.
docs.lead_paragraph: The film mogul Darryl F. Zanuck was among the skeptics in the years before networks started broadcasting shows seven nights a week. “Television won’t be able to hold on to any market it captures after the first six months,” he infamously predicted. “People will soon get tired of staring at a plywood box every night.”

headline.main: In the Race for Content, Hollywood Is Buying Up Hit Podcasts
headline.print_headline: From Earbud To Screen: Studios Vie For Podcasts

docs.abstract: Companies repeat themselves in dull earnings reports. But when they make many changes in the text from year to year, it often signals trouble.
docs.snippet: Companies repeat themselves in dull earnings reports. But when they make many changes in the text from year to year, it often signals trouble.
docs.lead_paragraph: Don’t blame Wall Street analysts, rank-and-file investors and journalists for failing to read corporate earnings reports from beginning to end.

headline.main: How Companies Like Apple Sprinkle Secrets in Earnings Reports
headline.print_headline: Secrets Are Sprinkled in Those Oh-So-Dull Earnings Reports

docs.abstract: The video gaming industry is growing but it’s not clear which, if any sectors, are the most promising. Index funds have been a good solution lately.
docs.snippet: The video gaming industry is growing but it’s not clear which, if any sectors, are the most promising. Index funds have been a good solution lately.
docs.lead_paragraph: Video gaming has gone from an activity conducted in arcades, dens and rec rooms to a mobile phenomenon where players meet, live and play in virtual space.

headline.main: Investors Use Indexes to Play in the Video Game Business
headline.print_headline: The Video Game Industry Is Now in Play

docs.abstract: It is a show whose budgets and scale were once unthinkable for television — and now it’s become the gold standard.
docs.snippet: It is a show whose budgets and scale were once unthinkable for television — and now it’s become the gold standard.
docs.lead_paragraph: In the eight years since “Game of Thrones” went on the air, the television industry has been upended. We can thank Netflix for that.

headline.main: ‘Game of Thrones’ Changed TV. Let Us Count the Ways.

docs.abstract: Amazon’s effort could help answer a fundamental question: Will automation be a solution for the great challenges of the 21st century economy, or make those problems worse?
docs.snippet: Amazon’s effort could help answer a fundamental question: Will automation be a solution for the great challenges of the 21st century economy, or make those problems worse?
docs.lead_paragraph: As automation technology has leapt ahead, workers increasingly worry about losing their jobs to robots and algorithms. Economists dismiss those concerns, by and large, arguing that workers can grab higher-skilled jobs with better wages.

headline.main: Amazon’s Latest Experiment: Retraining Its Work Force
headline.print_headline: Amazon’s Price  To Retool Staff  Is $700 Million

byline.original: By Ben Casselman and Adam Satariano
